revised_title: Nonlinear Theory of Wave Propagation in Dispersive Systems: Applications to Water Waves
tldr: This paper discusses the use of variational methods in the theory of nonlinear dispersive waves, with a focus on water waves. The author presents the appropriate variational principle for water waves and derives long-wave approximations, such as the Boussinesq and Korteweg-de Vries equations. The paper also explores resonant near-linear interactions and the author's theory of slowly varying wavetrains, which are applied to Stokes's waves. Finally, the paper demonstrates how more general dispersive relations can be formulated using integro-differential equations, with an application to understanding the breaking of water waves.
